file_name: Wabtec Data Lake Separation Case Study 2.pptx
summary: A large-scale data lake migration was executed for a global company spanning freight, transit, electronics, and other sectors, following an ambitious merger. The project involved moving over 112TB of real-time, business-critical data across 30+ technologies to a new cloud-based platform, with zero data loss and minimal downtime. Genpact's cloud expertise and assets were leveraged to accelerate migration, using AWS infrastructure and open-source tools to create a scalable, cost-effective architecture. Automation via Chef scripts and Infrastructure as Code enabled rapid deployment and configuration, ensuring on-time go-live and seamless business continuity.
technology: AWS (IaaS), Open Source Stack, Chef Scripts, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), Hadoop

file_name: Reference Data Master and Customer Registry helps Major Cable Provider Case Study 1.pptx
summary: A major cable provider faced challenges in complying with CCPA regulations, requiring accurate identification, cleansing, and reporting of personal data stored across multiple business applications. The solution involved implementing an MDM Reference Master framework to integrate enterprise source applications and manage CCPA-impacted data attributes. This platform enabled data remediation, governance, and ensured consumer rights such as data access, deletion, and opt-out were properly audited and logged. Deduplication and survivorship rules were applied to create a validated, consolidated consumer report. The approach delivered a reusable, enterprise-wide solution for CCPA compliance.
technology: Master Data Management (MDM) Reference Master, Data Remediation, Data Governance, Deduplication and Survivorship Rules, Customer Registry

summary: Nike faced significant challenges during the pandemic, including a sharp decline in sales and operational inefficiencies due to fragmented systems and legacy applications. To enable growth in its direct-to-consumer channel, Nike implemented a cloud-based data and analytics transformation in its Finance function. Leveraging AWS and Snowflake, the solution provided improved revenue visibility, actionable SG&A insights, and substantial cash flow benefits. The transformation included automated data extraction, quality assurance, governance, and persona-driven visualization, resulting in reduced manual effort and enhanced agility.
technology: AWS, Snowflake Cloud Platform, Data & Analytics CoE, Data Streaming, Data Quality Assurance, Data Governance, Visualization Tools (Cognos, Tableau, Domo), AI/ML Predictive Analytics

summary: A leading investment and asset management firm implemented an AWS-based enterprise data hub to modernize its data architecture and management operations. The solution integrated diverse data sources, including transactions, sales, customer, campaign, and web analytics, to support advanced business use cases like sales dashboards and campaign effectiveness. The initiative resulted in reduced data processing timelines, lower infrastructure costs, and improved scalability and efficiency. Legacy systems were integrated and dependencies reduced, enabling enhanced analytics and business insights.
technology: AWS S3 Enterprise Data Lake, AWS Redshift, Apache Spark, AWS EMR, Lambda, Step Functions, Data Pipeline, Tableau, GIT, Jenkins

file_name: Improved data quality of the ‘client’ data by cleansing, enriching Case Study 3.pptx
summary: A diversified global insurer improved the quality of its client data by implementing a comprehensive data cleansing, enrichment, and deduplication process. Automated tools (D&B) handled 70% of the cleansing, while the remaining 30% was completed manually. The project defined critical data elements and sources, resulting in a 70% reduction in completeness issues and a 55% decrease in downstream problems, enhancing user experience and compliance. Data profiling and dashboards were used to monitor accuracy, integrity, and timeliness throughout the process.
technology: D&B (Dun & Bradstreet), Informatica Analyst, Informatica Data Quality (DQ), manual data cleansing, data profiling dashboards

file_name: Data Quality program for a large US-based Aviation Case Study 4.pptx
summary: A large US-based aviation organization faced challenges with inconsistent and non-standardized data spread across global locations, risking the identification of top business customers. The solution involved profiling data, developing cleansing and standardization rules, and using fuzzy matching to improve data quality. Informatica tools and reference tables were leveraged to validate and standardize international data, with cleansed data stored in an intermediary data store for integration with the client's MDM system. This program enabled proactive monitoring, improved data quality, and enhanced product stability across the enterprise.
technology: Informatica Analyst, Informatica Data Quality (DQ), Informatica PowerCenter (ETL), Address Doctor, Fuzzy Matching, Data Profiling

file_name: Data Quality led Data Governance organization operationalizationCase Study 6.pptx
summary: The organization faced challenges with data trust, ownership, and inefficient use of enterprise data services, lacking visibility into data changes and their impacts. To address these issues, a data governance organization and operating model were established using platforms like Collibra, Informatica, and IBM. Over 1800 critical data elements and 6000 data quality rules were implemented across 12 business domains in 8 months, providing clear data lineage and integrated quality metrics. Agile governance processes and a comprehensive handbook improved transparency and ownership, while visualizations showcased governance effectiveness.
technology: Collibra, Informatica, IBM, Data Governance Handbook, Data Quality Framework, Data Cockpit Visualizations

file_name: Data profiling, cleansing & future state design for a Large Financial Institution Case Study 2.pptx
summary: A large financial institution faced challenges due to the lack of formal data governance, data quality organizations, and centralized data management, resulting in inaccurate vendor master data and limited risk visibility. The solution involved data profiling, one-time cleansing, and designing a future state for processes, metrics, controls, and technology to improve data quality and governance. Key impacts included a 30% improvement in spend visibility, significant productivity gains, and enhanced vendor master data accuracy. The project also established a global data dictionary and recommended setting up a business data services organization.
technology: Informatica Analyst, Informatica Data Quality (DQ), self-serve vendor management tool

summary: The case study describes the implementation of a comprehensive Data Governance solution, focusing on documenting business and technical assets, and establishing complex data lineage across multiple data sources. The project involved automating metadata updates and data quality rule scoring for over 50 datasets and 500 rules, using advanced and custom scanners. Integration of tools like IDQ, EDC, and AXON enabled seamless enrichment of business metadata and traceability of data sources. The solution improved data quality monitoring and business glossary management, supporting better data stewardship.
technology: Informatica EDC, AXON, IDQ, custom lineage scanners, Oracle, AWS Aurora, Flat files, AWS S3, Snowflake

file_name: Data Governance  solution for a US Healthcare client (dental equipment Case Study 7.pptx
summary: Genpact implemented a comprehensive data governance solution for a US healthcare client specializing in dental equipment manufacturing. The client faced challenges with inconsistent data definitions and lack of data lineage visibility. Genpact created a unified business glossary, refined asset definitions, and established data lineage for over 40 datasets. The solution included identification of PII data and enrichment of technical assets with business metadata. End-to-end support was provided, including onboarding assets to Microsoft Purview and configuring metadata scanners across Azure and SQL databases.
technology: Microsoft Purview, Azure Data Lake, SQL, Azure SQL, metadata scanners

summary: A US multinational provider of data and technology in Dealer Services faced challenges with inconsistent data definitions, lack of a unified business glossary, and compliance with PII data requirements. Genpact implemented a data governance solution using Alation Data Governance, creating a comprehensive data catalog, business glossary, and data dictionary. The project involved ingesting metadata from multiple data sources, identifying over 7000 PII data elements, and establishing end-to-end data lineage to improve compliance and data visibility.
technology: Alation Data Governance, Alation APIs, SQL Server, Oracle, Snowflake, Amazon S3 Athena, Postgres, Looker, Tableau, PowerBI

summary: A global retail pharmacy client faced challenges with inconsistent corporate data definitions and lack of unified business glossaries. The project involved creating a comprehensive data catalog, business glossary, and KPI definition documents, supporting implementation and requirements gathering. Key activities included designing governance workflows, data classification, and establishing end-to-end metadata lineage. Custom workflows were developed using Core JAVA APIs, and integration with platforms like ServiceNow and Ataccama was initiated. Over 400 business glossary terms and lineage for 40+ datasets were created to optimize data governance and sharing policies.
technology: Collibra, Core JAVA APIs, ServiceNow, Ataccama, Data Catalogs, Metadata Management
